---
title: Key Components
description: Understanding the core components of Drupal MCP setup
---

MCP protocol defines two ways for transferring data between the client and the server - HTTP and STDIO. While HTTP is the most common way to transfer data between the clients and the servers, STDIO is more suitable for the desktop LLM applications. For example, Claude and Cursor use STDIO to communicate with the Drupal MCP server.

Having said that, for converting your Drupal as an MCP server, we need to support both ways of transport layers and Drupal MCP module does that. Supporting HTTP is easy and natural as Drupal itself is an HTTP animal, but for supporting the STDIO, we need a middleware thing that will reside on your local machine and help supporting the STDIO protocol.

All said above, we have three components:

1. [Drupal MCP Module (Server)](https://www.drupal.org/project/mcp)
2. [*Optional* STDIO Binary (Middleware)](https://github.com/Omedia/drupal-mcp-client)
3. LLM Application (or any MCP Client, including [Drupal MCP Client](https://drupal.org/project/mcp_client))
